sn47.27:4.3: “Reverend, they speak of this person called ‘a master’.
sn47.27:4.5: “Reverends, a master is someone who has completely developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
sn47.27:5.2: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.27:5.3: They meditate by observing an aspect of feelings …
sn47.27:5.5: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn47.27:5.6: A master is someone who has completely developed the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.”
